lines.text: We're running a circus, not a charm school.

[after Matilda is thrown out of Frank's trailer]
Matilda, darling, you should be careful about leaving like that; you'll damage your brain.
The French Revolution could have been avoided if Louis XVI had given the people a reason to celebrate.
Don't forget what happened to Marie Antoinette.

[after Matilda is thrown out of Frank's trailer]
Quite a party.
What? That you've been entertaining a woman in your caravan dressed like that?
She came in and I threw her out
Well, you're no saint and she's attractive in a common sort of way. Why did you throw her out.

[when Matilda shows up in his caravan with a bottle and glasses]
I don't drink.
Oh, you miserable, gutless adding machine! What are you trying to do, ruin my circus?
